metadata.title: Air Canada ramping up operations to near full schedule by Friday

left: Air Canada expects to be operating close to its full network schedule by Friday.
The airline announced it is ramping up operations after reaching a tentative deal with the union representing its flight attendants to end a strike.
The strike disrupted operations, leading to flight cancellations.
Voting for more than 10,000 flight attendants on a new tentative agreement will begin next week.
center: Air Canada expects to be operating close to its full network schedule by Friday.
The airline announced it is ramping up operations after reaching a tentative deal with the union representing its flight attendants to end a strike.
The strike disrupted operations, leading to flight cancellations.
Voting for more than 10,000 flight attendants on a new tentative agreement will begin next week.
right: Air Canada expects to be operating close to its full network schedule by Friday.
The airline announced it is ramping up operations after reaching a tentative deal with the union representing its flight attendants to end a strike.
The strike disrupted operations, leading to flight cancellations.
Voting for more than 10,000 flight attendants on a new tentative agreement will begin next week.
